source_sentence: 我今為說世尊所制八尊敬法，今應諦聽善思念之！」

translation: The great lord of the world then said, Please explain it for me and listen with one mind.

translation: What's the matter with the other women who haven't yet decided?

translation: The Buddha told Upāli, The rest of the women will be given renunciation and approximate completion in order according to the rules.

translation: When the women heard this teaching, they didn't know what order it was.

translation: If a woman who wishes to renounce the householder’s life visits a nun and pays her respects, that nun should ask her about the method of overcoming the obstacle. If there is no difficulty, she should be allowed to do so.

translation: It's like the noble arhats who preserve their lives and don't kill or steal, don't engage in sexual misconduct, don't speak falsehoods, and don't drink alcohol.

source_sentence: 我某甲始從今日乃至命存，不殺生、不偷盜、不欲邪行、不虛誑語不飲諸酒亦如是，
translation: So it is with me, Mr. A., who from today onwards keeps the precept against taking life, against stealing, against sexual misconduct, against speaking falsehoods, and against ingesting intoxicants.

translation: As a result, the nuns and nuns are gradually given to other people who leave home and become bhikṣuṇīs in their near-complete form. In this way, they are gradually given to others, and the nuns increase in number.

translation: At another time, the superior monks and nuns visited the great world lord Gautama and said, Good, you should know, noble one!

source_sentence: 我等苾芻尼眾出家已久，諸餘苾芻年少出家近圓未久，令依大小互相恭敬。」
translation: It's been a long time since we bhikṣus and nuns have left home, and it's not long before the other bhikṣus are young enough to leave home, so they will respect each other according to their size.

source_sentence: 作是語已，時大世主喬答彌言：「諸妹！
translation: After he said this, the great world lord Gautama then said, Sisters!

source_sentence: 可待須臾，我詣聖者阿難陀處諮問斯事。」
translation: In a moment, I'll go to the place of the noble Ānanda and ask about this matter.

source_sentence: 即往具壽阿難陀所說如上事，阿難陀曰：「大世主！
translation: He went to Kauśinagara and told him the above, and Ānanda said, Great lord of the world!

source_sentence: 且待少時，我往白佛。」
translation: Just wait a little while, and I'll go to the Buddha and tell him.

translation: Why is it so?

translation: If that woman doesn't leave home in the midst of a good teaching, the faithful elders and brāhmaṇas see the monks holding delicious food.

source_sentence: 共相給施令無闕乏。
translation: They give gifts to each other so that they don't lack.

source_sentence: 阿難陀！
translation: Ānanda!

translation: It will cause me to gain great benefits for a long time and attain peace and happiness for a long time.'

translation: Furthermore, Ānanda!

translation: It's even more so for the other kinds of non-Buddhist dead corpses.

source_sentence: 復次阿難陀！
translation: Furthermore, Ānanda!

source_sentence: 若其女人不出家者，我之教法滿一千年，具足清淨無諸染污；
translation: If that woman does not renounce household life, my teaching will be complete for the duration of one thousand years. She will be endowed with purity and without any defilement.

source_sentence: 由出家故減五百年。
translation: Because he renounced the householder’s life, it decreased by five hundred years.

source_sentence: 是故阿難陀！
translation: Therefore, Ānanda!

source_sentence: 我令百歲近圓苾芻尼，應當尊重合掌迎接恭敬頂禮新受近圓苾芻。」
translation: I'll cause a hundred-year-old bhikṣuṇī who's nearing completion to venerate the newly ordained bhikṣu by joining his palms and greeting him with respect.

source_sentence: 緣處同前。
translation: The locus of cognition is the same as the previous one.

source_sentence: 時諸苾芻尼，有四人眾事、五人眾事、十二人眾事起，彼便總集二部僧伽。
translation: When the monks and nuns then had four-person, five-person, and twelve-person congregations that arose, they then gathered the two groups of monks together.

translation: As there were so many matters to attend to, they prevented the Master from studying and reciting the scriptures.

source_sentence: 時諸苾芻以緣白佛，佛言：「二眾事別，唯除出罪、近圓及半月等法事須共為，

source_sentence: 餘皆別作。」
translation: The rest are made separately.

translation: It was then that an elderly man in the city of Śrāvastī became pregnant soon after he married his wife and gave birth to a daughter at the end of the month.

source_sentence: 生已父亡，母養既大其母亦終。
translation: After he was born, his father died, and as his mother's nurturing grew older, so did his mother.

source_sentence: 後時吐羅難陀尼因乞食入其舍，見女問曰：「汝屬於誰？」
translation: Later, Tārānanda entered his dwelling because he was begging for food and saw the woman and asked, To whom do you belong?

source_sentence: 答言：「聖者！
translation: He replied, Sage!

source_sentence: 我無依怙曾未屬人。」
translation: I have no support and never belonged to anyone.

source_sentence: 報言：「若如是者何不出家？」
translation: He replied, If that's the case, why don't you leave home?

source_sentence: 女曰：「誰與我出家？」
translation: The woman said, Who will leave home with me?

source_sentence: 尼曰：「我能與汝，可隨我去。」
translation: The nun said, I can give it to you; follow me.

source_sentence: 彼即隨行，至尼住處便與出家，後被煩惱之所牽纏遂便還俗。
translation: He then follows them, goes to the nun's dwelling place, leaves home, and later is tethered by affliction, so he returns to secular life.

source_sentence: 時吐羅難陀尼因出乞食遇見其女，問言：「少女！
translation: When he went out to solicit alms, Tārānandaṇi met his daughter and asked her, Young woman!

source_sentence: 如何得活？」
translation: How can I live?

source_sentence: 答言：「聖者！
translation: He replied, Sage!

source_sentence: 我無依怙，辛苦存生。」
translation: I have no support, and I work hard to save my life.

source_sentence: 報言：「若爾，何故更不出家？」
translation: He replied, If that's the case, why don't you leave home?

source_sentence: 答曰：「我已還俗，誰與出家？」
translation: He replied, I've returned to the secular world, so who will leave home with me?

source_sentence: 尼曰：「我能。」
translation: The nun said, I can.

source_sentence: 即與出家遂行乞食。
translation: He then gave it to the renunciant and went begging for food.

source_sentence: 長者婆羅門見已皆共譏嫌：「諸釋迦女能為善事，或時出家而修梵行，
translation: When the elders and brāhmaṇas saw this, they all criticized it, saying, “The Śākya maidens are capable of performing good deeds.

source_sentence: 或時罷道還染俗塵，隨情所為豈非善事。」
translation: If someone sometimes leaves the path and returns to defile the worldly dust, isn't it a good thing to do according to their feelings?

source_sentence: 諸尼聞已白諸苾芻，苾芻白佛，佛作是念：「由還俗尼有如是過，從今已去諸還俗尼更不得出家。
translation: After hearing this, the nuns said to the monks, and the monks said to the Buddha, who thought, Because there's such a mistake with returning laymen, they won't be allowed to leave home again from now on.

source_sentence: 其長者等善為譏笑損壞我法，是故苾芻尼一捨法服已歸俗者，不應更令出家。
translation: Because those elders and others are well-versed in ridiculing and disparaging my teaching, a monk or nun who renounces the Dharma robe once and returns to secular life shouldn't be allowed to leave home again.

source_sentence: 若與出家者，師主得越法罪。」
translation: If he gives it to someone who leaves home, the teacher or master will be guilty of transgressing the Dharma.

source_sentence: 因度喬答彌，　　出家有五利，
translation: In order to save Gautama, there are five benefits of leaving home.

source_sentence: 可於五眾內，　　訶責事應知。
translation: You should know the matter of reprimanding within the fivefold assemblies.

source_sentence: 第六門第六子攝頌曰：緣處同前。
translation: The sixth aspect of the sixth son gathers a verse that says, Conditioned places are the same as the previous one.

source_sentence: 爾時婆羅痆斯有一長者名瞿答摩，大富多財，娶妻未久便持財貨往得叉城而為興易，
translation: At the time, there was an elder named Gautama in Vārāṇasī who was very wealthy and possessed a great deal of property. Soon after he married his wife, he took his property and went to Takṣa City to exchange it for profit.

source_sentence: 既至彼已便詣一家而求住止。
translation: After arriving there, he went to a house and asked to stay there.

source_sentence: 時彼主人長者號曰名稱，見唱：「善來！」
translation: The host and elder then called out to him, Fame, and saw him singing, Welcome!

source_sentence: 歡懷命坐，因即相知共為交密。
translation: They sat with joy and ordered him to take his seat, so they knew each other and shared the same secret.

source_sentence: 時瞿答摩賣舊持新還歸故邑。
translation: Gautama then sold the old and took the new and returned to his old town.

source_sentence: 後於異時主人長者，因為興易到婆羅痆斯，遂投瞿答摩家而為停止，彼見驚喜唱言：「善來！」
translation: On another occasion, the host and elder went to Vārāṇasī in order to rise up and stay there, so he joined the householder Gautama's house and stopped.

source_sentence: 共申久好。
translation: Together, they've been good for a long time.

source_sentence: 時得叉長者告瞿答摩曰：「作何方便，我等歿後所有子孫共為親愛不相疎隔？」
translation: The elder Takṣa then addressed Gautama, What's the method for us to keep all our children and grandchildren together as relatives and not separate from each other after we die?

source_sentence: 瞿答摩曰：「善哉斯語！
translation: Gautama said, Good, that's what you say!

source_sentence: 今可共作指腹之親，我等二家若生男女共為婚媾。」
translation: Now, we can be the relatives of each other's fingers and abdomen, and if we two families give birth to men and women together, we'll be married.

source_sentence: 彼言：「可爾，我意同然。」
translation: They said, Yes, it's the same as mine.

source_sentence: 時彼長者賣舊持新遂歸本宅。
translation: The elder then sold the old and kept the new, so he returned to his original home.

source_sentence: 其婦有娠月滿生男，經三七日聚會諸親，與兒作字名曰遊方。
translation: The woman had a baby boy who was pregnant for the full moon, and after thirty-seven days she gathered her relatives to give him the name遊方.

source_sentence: 于時婆羅痆斯瞿答摩，聞彼生男情甚歡悅，便作是念：「得叉長者共我交親，
translation: When Vārāṇasī Guṇama heard this, he was overjoyed and thought:

source_sentence: 今既生男，我當生女，彼是女夫可作嚴身瓔珞衣服。」
translation: Now that a man has been born, I will give birth to a woman, and that woman's husband can make an ornamented jewelry or clothing for her.

source_sentence: 令使送去并持書曰：「聞君生男情甚欣悅，今送衣服願垂納受。」
translation: He ordered his envoy to send it away and took a letter with him, saying, I've heard you give rise to the feeling of great joy in your male state, so now I'll send you my clothes and wish to accept them.

source_sentence: 得叉長者得書領信，還以書答。
translation: When the householder Takṣa got the letter, he accepted it and returned with a reply in writing.
